arm_group.description: patients with non-cystic fibrosis bronchiectasis will be evaluated cross-sectionally
healthy control subjects will be evaluated cross-sectionally

brief_summary.textblock:
Non-cystic fibrosis bronchiectasis patients (and controls) were recruited for the study. The
      investigators' aim was to study the relevance of clinical parameters in terms of underlying
      disease severity, proteolysis and inflammation in a diverse non-cystic fibrosis
      bronchiectasis population.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Sputum Colour Chart as a Predictor of Lung Inflammation and Proteolysis in Non-cystic Fibrosis Bronchiectasis

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients from the non-cystic fibrosis bronchiectasis (NCFB) outpatient clinic were recruited
      in our study from September 2009 till July 2010. Control healthy subjects were recruited
      among peers of the patient or hospital staff during the same period. For the NCFB patients,
      underlying etiologies of NCFB and Pseudomonas aeruginosa (PA) colonization status were
      analyzed and each patient was evaluated by means of spirometry (FVC and FEV1), Leicester
      Cough Questionnaire (LCQ) and Sputum Colour Chart (SCC). SCC assessment was both done by
      letting the patient predict his sputum purulence prior to sputum induction and by SCC
      scoring after sputum harvest by the physician.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnosis of NCFB, based on CT findings of bronchiectatic disease in the absence of
             cystic fibrosis (CF) as a cause.

          -  stable

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  no recent exacerbation

clinical_study.official_title: The Sputum Colour Chart as a Predictor of Lung Inflammation, Proteolysis and Damage in Non-cystic Fibrosis Bronchiectasis

primary_outcome.description: Airway inflammation will be assessed by analysis of sputum differential cell counts and cytokine/chemokine analysis in sputum.
primary_outcome.measure: Assess predictive value of sputum colour chart to evaluate airway inflammation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Proteolytic activity of sputum enzymes (total gelatinolytic activity) and sputum enzymes (neutrophil elastase, MMP9)  will be quantified in sputum supernatant of NCFB patients and controls.
secondary_outcome.measure: Link the degree of airway inflammation to the proteolytic activity of sputum enzymes.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
